org.apache.james.rrt.api

Interface RecipientRewriteTable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    JamesUsersRepository
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractJamesUsersRepository, AbstractJdbcUsersRepository, AbstractRecipientRewriteTable, DefaultUsersJdbcRepository, HBaseRecipientRewriteTable, JamesUsersJdbcRepository, JDBCRecipientRewriteTable, JPARecipientRewriteTable, UsersFileRepository, XMLRecipientRewriteTable

    public interface RecipientRewriteTable
    Interface which should be implemented of classes which map recipients.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RecipientRewriteTable.ErrorMappingException 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ALIASDOMAIN_PREFIX
      The prefix which is used for alias domain mappings
      static String ERROR_PREFIX
      The prefix which is used for error mappings
      static String REGEX_PREFIX
      The prefix which is used for regex mappings
      static String WILDCARD
      The wildcard used for alias domain mappings

    • Method Detail

      • getMappings

        Collection<String> getMappings(String user,
                             String domain)
                               throws RecipientRewriteTable.ErrorMappingException,
                                      RecipientRewriteTableException
        Return the mapped MailAddress for the given address. Return null if no matched mapping was found
        Parameters:
        user - the MailAddress
        Returns:
        the mapped mailAddress
        Throws:
        RecipientRewriteTable.ErrorMappingException - get thrown if an error mapping was found
        RecipientRewriteTableException

      • addRegexMapping

        void addRegexMapping(String user,
                   String domain,
                   String regex)
                     throws RecipientRewriteTableException
        Add regex mapping
        Parameters:
        user - the username. Null if no username should be used
        domain - the domain. Null if no domain should be used
        regex - the regex.
        Throws:
        RecipientRewriteTableException

                      String domain,

                        throws RecipientRewriteTableException
        Remove regex mapping
        Parameters:
        user - the username. Null if no username should be used
        domain - the domain. Null if no domain should be used
        regex - the regex.
        Throws:
        RecipientRewriteTableException

      • getUserDomainMappings

        Collection<String> getUserDomainMappings(String user,
                                       String domain)
                                         throws RecipientRewriteTableException
        Return the explicit mapping stored for the given user and domain. Return null if no mapping was found
        Parameters:
        user - the username
        domain - the domain
        Returns:
        the collection which holds the mappings.
        Throws:
        RecipientRewriteTableException

      • getAllMappings

        Map<String,Collection<String>> getAllMappings()
                                              throws RecipientRewriteTableException
        Return a Map which holds all mappings. The key is the user@domain and the value is a Collection which holds all mappings
        Returns:
        Map which holds all mappings
        Throws:
        RecipientRewriteTableException
